article.headline: Idaho State 74, Montana 73
article.story: MISSOULA, Mont. (AP) -- Returning starter Kevin Criswell led with 17 points as Montana built on a slight halftime advantage to beat Great Falls 83-62 Thursday night in an exhibition game. Criswell, the Grizzlies' second-leading scorer last season, was 4-of-8 from the three-point line. He was joined in double figures by another returning starter, Kamarr Davis with 14 points and five rebounds. Overall, Montana shot 59.2 percent from the field, compared with 28.8 percent for Great Falls. The Argos were led by Todd Tomlinson with 17 points. John Chapman added 11 points and grabbed 12 rebounds. Montana's next in action Nov. 12 in a home exhibition game against Montana-Western. UM's regular season starts on the road Nov. 21 against Gonzaga. Great Falls plays at home Sunday against the University of Mary.
